intro: Adenia stenodactyla var. kondensis, commonly known as the Kondé adenium, is a variant of the adenium genus native to parts of Africa. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and striking, lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, adding to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, demonstrating drought tolerance. Its botanical features make it a unique and resilient species within the Apocynaceae family.
